# Cambridge IGCSE™

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 222, 170, 250]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 212, 425, 259]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[620, 220, 720, 250]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[735, 212, 905, 256]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 230, 292]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 905, 292]]<|/det|>
0580/42  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 301, 243, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 4 (Extended)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 301, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
October/November 2024  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[740, 325, 905, 341]]<|/det|>
2 hours 30 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 395, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 400, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: Geometrical instruments  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 433]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 855, 620]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You may use tracing paper.- You must show all necessary working clearly.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.- For \(\pi\), use either your calculator value or 3.142.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 650, 212, 665]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 730, 698]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 130.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 69, 94, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 69, 146, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[160, 69, 322, 87]]<|/det|>
Anvi buys a new car.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 101, 183, 120]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 101, 437, 120]]<|/det|>
The price of the car is \(28 240.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 116, 430, 135]]<|/det|>
She is given a \(7.5\%\) discount.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 147, 437, 166]]<|/det|>
Calculate the amount she pays.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[625, 255, 923, 274]]<|/det|>
<form>$\$ ....................................................$

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 256, 920, 275]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 287, 180, 306]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 287, 621, 306]]<|/det|>
The fuel tank in the new car has a capacity of 45 litres.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 303, 643, 322]]<|/det|>
This is \(72\%\) of the capacity of the fuel tank in her old car.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 333, 603, 352]]<|/det|>
Calculate the capacity of the fuel tank in her old car.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[640, 473, 920, 492]]<|/det|>
<form>....................................... litres

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 504, 146, 523]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 504, 447, 523]]<|/det|>
Aadi buys a new car costing \(28 000.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 520, 472, 539]]<|/det|>
He pays for the car using a finance plan.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 536, 308, 555]]<|/det|>
The finance plan is

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 567, 270, 585]]<|/det|>
· a deposit

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 581, 477, 600]]<|/det|>
· 47 equal monthly payments of \(\) 330

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 597, 408, 616]]<|/det|>
· a final payment of \(\) 11 490.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 628, 650, 648]]<|/det|>
Using this finance plan, Aadi pays a total of \(31 900 for the car.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 660, 576, 679]]<|/det|>
Calculate the deposit paid as a percentage of \(\) 28 000.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[640, 860, 920, 878]]<|/det|>
<form>....................................... \(\%\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 860, 920, 878]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 87]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 512, 88]]<|/det|>
A car travels \(64\mathrm{km}\) and uses 2.5 litres of fuel.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 87, 517, 103]]<|/det|>
It then travels \(128\mathrm{km}\) and uses 6 litres of fuel.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 117, 702, 134]]<|/det|>
Calculate the rate at which the car uses fuel during the whole journey.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 133, 457, 149]]<|/det|>
Give your answer in litres per \(100\mathrm{km}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[640, 256, 920, 274]]<|/det|>
<form>.................... litres per \(100\mathrm{km}\)  [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 288, 146, 305]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 288, 556, 305]]<|/det|>
At the start of 2021 the value of a car was \(\) 46 500.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 304, 571, 320]]<|/det|>
At the end of 2021 the value of the car was \(20\%\) less.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 319, 824, 337]]<|/det|>
At the end of 2022 the value of the car was \(15\%\) less than its value at the end of 2021.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 350, 537, 368]]<|/det|>
Calculate the value of the car at the end of 2022.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[625, 520, 925, 537]]<|/det|>
